It's a tale as old as time ‚Äì he stole her heart, so she stole his...frozen brains.
Sometimes, when a couple breaks up, it's not that easy to divide up the possessions. This is especially true when the coupleM√°s are co-owners of a cryogenics lab. After her husband allegedly left to start a family with another woman, 59-year-old Valeria Udalova decided to take half of the company's stock.
Udalova's big brain move (literally) was to break into the Moscow lab and steal the frozen brains of people who'd paid tens of thousands of dollars to hopefully be brought back to life one day. Police are still looking for Udalova, and there are now concerns that the brains may have been damaged in transit.
However, theories that she smuggled the brains out under a really big hat are probably not true.
